net.springjpa.mvc.rac.controller

Class RequestAccountController

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.springjpa.mvc.rac.controller.RequestAccountController

  • @RestController
public class RequestAccountController
extends java.lang.Object
    REST Controller
    Links:
    GET - http://localhost:8080/RequestAccount/ - test endpoint
    POST - http://localhost:8080/RequestAccount/user/ + {user json} - Creates new user
    GET - http://localhost:8080/RequestAccount/user/{id} - Request user from DB
    PUT - http://localhost:8080/RequestAccount/user/{id} + {user json} - Update user from DB
    DELETE - http://localhost:8080/RequestAccount/user/{id} - Delete user from DB
    GET - http://localhost:8080/RequestAccount/users/ - Retreive the list of users from DB
    Author:
    SorinCarcalicea

      • createUser

        @RequestMapping(value="/user/",
                method=POST,
                produces="application/json",
                consumes="application/json")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> createUser(@RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     User json,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     org.springframework.web.util.UriComponentsBuilder ucBuilder)
        Create new user
        POST - http://localhost:8080/RequestAccount/user/{user json} - Creates new user
        Parameters:
        json - - user json from UI
        Returns:
        user json and Http Status (CONFLICT if user is present in data base, CREATED if user was created successfully)

      • getUser

        @RequestMapping(value="/user/{id}",
                method=GET,
                produces="application/json")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<User> getUser(@PathVariable(value="id")
                                                                                                                                                                             int id)
        Retrieve user from data base
        GET - http://localhost:8080/RequestAccount/user/{id} - Request user from DB
        Parameters:
        id - - id for user to retrieve
        Returns:
        - HttpStatus (NOT_FOUND or OK)

                                                                                                                                  @RequestBody
                                                                                                                                  User user)
        Update user from data base

        @RequestMapping(value="/user/{id}",
                method=DELETE)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<User> deleteUser(@PathVariable(value="id")

        Delete user from database
        DELETE - http://localhost:8080/RequestAccount/user/{id} - Delete user from DB
        Parameters:
        id - - id for user to delete
        Returns:
        - HttpStatus (NOT_FOUND or NO_CONTENT)

      • listAllUsers

        @RequestMapping(value="/users/",
                method=GET)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<User>> listAllUsers()
        Get the list of all users
        GET - http://localhost:8080/RequestAccount/users/ - Request all user from DB
        Returns:
        - json with list of all users and HttpStatus (NO_CONTENT if there are no users and OK for list with users)
